intro: Cordia macleodii, commonly known as the Madagascar glorybower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the genus Cordia in the family Boraginaceae, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually arranged in clusters and can range in color from white to pink or red, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
